author: Alisha Sachdev, Dan Strumpf
description: India and China share a complicated relationship. The world’s two most populous nations are outright regional rivals who fought a border war in the 1960s. Relations have been at a low point since border clashes in 2020 left soldiers dead on both sides.
title: Why India Needs China, and China Needs India in Return

author: Julie Fine, Joe Lovinger
description: The Texas House of Representatives gave preliminary approval to a new state congressional map backed by President Donald Trump, capping a weeks-long political standoff and setting the stage for a final vote.
title: Texas Redistricting Plan Backed by Trump Wins Initial Approval

author: Yvonne Yue Li
description: One of the largest makers of copper wire and cable in the US is applauding the Trump administration for adding import tariffs on aluminum and copper derivative products, saying the move will help American manufacturers.
title: Southwire Praises Copper Tariffs It Says Will Help US Companies

author: Christopher Condon
description: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook signaled her intention to remain at the central bank in defiance of calls for her resignation by President Donald Trump over allegations of mortgage fraud.
title: Fed’s Cook Says She Won’t Be Bullied Into Stepping Down

author: Natalia Drozdiak
description: Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard announced plans to shrink her agency by 40% by the end of the year in what she called an effort to make the office more efficient, even as she clashes with the national security community she leads.
title: Gabbard Unveils Plan to Slash Top Spy Agency by 40% This Year

author: Matt Day
description: Microsoft Corp. activist employees and supporters were detained by police after returning to the company’s headquarters for a second day to demand that the software maker sever business ties with the Israeli military.
title: Microsoft Activists Detained Protesting Israel Ties at HQ Campus

author: Manuela Tobias, Nicolle Yapur
description: Argentine sovereign bonds fell Wednesday after lawmakers dealt a blow to one of President Javier Milei’s vetoes as congressional opponents pushed back against his austerity campaign before October midterm elections.
title: Argentine Bonds Drop As Milei’s Veto Suffers Setback in Congress

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the Trump administration’s latest salvo at the Federal Reserve. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Escalates Pressure Campaign on Fed, Calls for Cook to Quit

author: Emily Flitter
description: Texas officials are warning health care providers to stop sending abortion pills into the state or risk fines and prosecution, as Attorney General Ken Paxton seeks to halt the flow of medicine that’s circumventing local restrictions.
title: Texas Is Warning Health Providers to Stop Mailing Abortion Pills to State

author: Olga Kharif, Bill Allison
description: Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss, the twin brothers who run the Gemini cryptocurrency exchange, said they’ve donated $21 million in Bitcoin to a Republican-oriented political action committee to help President Donald Trump expand his pro-digital asset agenda going into the US midterm elections.
title: Gemini’s Winklevoss Brothers Donate $21 Million in Bitcoin to a Trump-Friendly PAC

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: Militias in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo have committed massacres, ethnically targeted killings and gang rapes, two human rights group reported Wednesday.
title: Potential War Crimes Rampant in Eastern Congo, Rights Groups Say

author: Myles Miller
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is pushing back on criticism that the surge of law enforcement and National Guard troops to Washington has focused on low-crime, relatively affluent or tourist-intensive areas of the nation’s capital.
title: Trump Team Touts Arrests, Pushes Back on Critics of DC Takeover

author: Charlotte Hughes-Morgan
description: The Netherlands will send two Patriot air defense systems to Poland as European allies step up efforts to defend NATO territory.
title: Netherlands to Supply Two Patriot Air Defense Systems to Poland

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: European leaders are discussing a security guarantee for Ukraine that would commit Kyiv’s allies to decide within 24 hours whether to provide military support to the country if it’s again attacked by Russia.
title: Meloni Offers Plan to Aid Ukraine in a Day if Russia Resumes War

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK’s former ambassador to China, Barbara Woodward, is expected to be named Keir Starmer’s new deputy national security adviser, as the prime minister seeks to beef up his foreign policy team.
title: UK Poised to Name Former China Envoy as Deputy Security Adviser

author: Philip Aldrick
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is considering taxing high-value family homes as she looks for ways to plug a multibillion-pound hole in the upcoming budget.
title: UK’s Reeves Looks at Family Home Tax to Fill Looming Budget Hole

author: Jim Wyss
description: President Donald Trump’s “America First” tariff policies are boosting manufacturing in Puerto Rico, an island he has both attacked and claimed to help more than any other US leader.
title: Trump’s America First Tariffs Gives Puerto Rico a Surprise Lift

author: Curtis Heinzl
description: Mark Carney’s government has been trying to reach a new trade accord with the US, but most Canadians are skeptical that President Donald Trump will keep his word on any deal.
title: About 80% of Canadians Say Trump Won’t Honor a Trade Deal, Poll Finds

author: Eltaf Najafizada
description: China wants Afghanistan to formally join its Belt and Road Initiative, the Afghan foreign ministry said in a post on X after the two countries’ foreign ministers held talks in Kabul on Wednesday.
title: Afghanistan Says China Seeks its Participation in Belt and Road Initiative

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israel’s central bank left interest rates unchanged for a 13th consecutive time, as policymakers weigh a slowdown in the economy against ongoing uncertainty from the country’s nearly two-year war in Gaza.
title: Israel Keeps Rates on Hold on Uncertainty Over War in Gaza

author: Lucy White
description: The UK government is braced for a slew of copycat legal challenges after a court ruled Tuesday that asylum seekers could no longer be housed in a hotel in Epping, to the northeast of London, posing a challenge to ministers as they try to find fresh accommodation.
title: Starmer Faces Fresh Crisis After Court Ruling on Asylum Hotel

author: Piotr Bujnicki
description: Polish authorities said on Wednesday that an unidentified military drone crashed in eastern part of the country.
title: Poland Says Unidentified Military Drone Crashes in East

author: Dina Bass, Emily Forgash
description: A US government plan to take a stake in Intel Corp. would give the ailing chipmaker a powerful backer, even if a bigger challenge still lies ahead: finding enough paying customers.
title: Intel Rescue Will Depend on Trump as Investor — and Pitchman

author: Ray Ndlovu
description: The US Embassy in Zimbabwe suspended most visa services in the southern African nation until further notice, while indicating that the move doesn’t constitute an outright travel ban.
title: US Temporarily Halts Most Visa Services for Zimbabwean Nationals

author: Walter Brandimarte
description: A new wave of right-wing politicians seems poised to win most of the region's presidential contests.
title: Latin America’s Leftist Leaders Are Fading

author: Weilun Soon, Rakesh Sharma, Mihir Mishra
description: One month after being hit by European Union sanctions, India’s Nayara Energy Ltd. is relying on a growing pool of dark-fleet tankers to transport its products, and a narrowing menu of crude imports to keep its operations running.
title: India’s Nayara Turns to Dark Fleet and Russian Oil for Survival

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Jing Li, Colum Murphy
description: India and China have agreed to explore demarcating their disputed border, a key move toward resolving decades-old territorial disputes as the neighbors look to recalibrate ties against the backdrop of strained India-US relations.
title: India and China to Explore Border Demarcation Amid US Tensions

author: Colum Murphy
description: China said that it will show off new weapons at a military parade next month, potentially giving rivals like the US a first chance to see what hardware the Asian nation is ready to field.
title: China Teases Glimpse of Advanced New Weaponry at Military Parade

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: He stormed to office as the world’s youngest head of state. Since then, a fumbled response to devastating wildfires caps a run of disappointments for the leftist leader — and for Chile.
title: A Leftist Promise in Latin America Is Damaged by Boric's Failures

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Llegó al poder como el jefe de Estado más joven del mundo. Desde entonces, su torpe respuesta a los devastadores incendios forestales ha sido la guinda de una serie de decepciones para el líder de izquierda y para Chile.
title: Del triunfo histórico al desencanto: el difícil legado de Boric en Chile

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Russia expects India to continue buying its oil, a senior official said, even as the South Asian nation faces higher US tariffs and harsh criticism from Trump administration officials for the trade.
title: Russia Sees Its Oil Discount Big Enough to Keep India Customer

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Newly imposed liquidity measures aimed at containing a nascent peso selloff have stoked tensions between Argentine President Javier Milei and the country’s banks, a sector that was largely aligned with his policy goals but now sees its profitability under threat.
title: Milei Clashes With Top Banks Amid Argentina’s Liquidity Squeeze

author: Krystof Chamonikolas
description: The Czech Republic must drop its penchant for “fiscal self-flagellation” in favor of investing in economic growth, according to a senior official from an opposition party poised to sweep to victory in October elections.
title: Czech Opposition Party Pledges to End Austerity If Wins Election

author: Sherif Tarek
description: Syria’s top diplomat held US-mediated talks with Israeli delegates in Paris, seeking to defuse tensions following a flare-up of sectarian violence that prompted Israel to strike its neighboring country last month.
title: Syrian and Israeli Officials Hold Paris Talks to Ease Tensions

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israel’s military is set to start the call-up of around 60,000 reserve soldiers for a stepped up offensive in Gaza against Hamas, according to an Israeli government official, even as it readies a response to a new ceasefire proposal.
title: Israel to Start Call-Up of 60,000 Reservists for Gaza Offensive

author: Loni Prinsloo, S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa is prioritizing a policy-review process that may result in Elon Musk’s SpaceX and other satellite-internet companies being allowed to operate in Africa’s largest economy without ceding ownership, the nation’s telecoms minister said.
title: South Africa Pushes Rule Review That Would Ease Starlink Entry

author: Michael O'Boyle
description: Two Mexican banks targeted by the administration of US President Donald Trump for potentially aiding money laundering by drug cartels have sold significant parts of their operations, the government said on Tuesday.
title: Mexican Banks Targeted by Trump Sold to Continue Operations

author: Josh Wingrove
description: The director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency is urging Attorney General Pam Bondi to investigate Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook over a pair of mortgages, the latest in a series of moves by the Trump administration to increase legal scrutiny of Democratic figures and appointees.
title: Trump Ally Calls on Bondi to Probe Fed’s Cook Over Mortgages

author: Philip Glamann
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent indicated that the US is satisfied with the current tariff arrangement with China, a signal the Trump administration is looking to keep ties calm before a trade truce expires in November.
title: Bessent Says Tariff Status Quo With China ‘Working Pretty Well’

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea ruled out a role for South Korea in any regional diplomatic talks related to Pyongyang and warned of “countermeasures” against “the most hostile state” as it criticized the ongoing military cooperation between Seoul and Washington.
title: Kim’s Sister Says No Role for Seoul in North Korea Diplomacy

author: Bill Allison
description: President Donald Trump has bought hundreds of bonds since he returned to office, including those sold by US companies affected by the sweeping changes to federal policies he’s championed.
title: Trump Embarks on $104 Million Bond-Buying Spree While in Office

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Chiranjivi Chakraborty
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed improved ties with China as US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent escalated criticism of the South Asian nation over its purchases of Russian oil.
title: Modi Hails China Ties as Bessent Swipes at India’s Rich Families

author: Michael Heath
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accused his Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese of betrayal for planning to recognize a Palestinian state, in a rare public attack on a historically friendly nation.
title: Netanyahu Attacks Australia for Recognizing Palestinian State
